div.p: Change in energy balance after one year after fire. Immediate (1 year) impacts of fire-induced forest loss on the surface energy flux as a result of changes in a incoming shortwave radiation (△SW in), b upwelling longwave radiation (△LW out), c the combination of sensible and ground heat fluxes (△(HE + G)), and d the latent heat flux (△LE). For the latitudinal summaries of impacts, black lines represent annual impacts, red lines represent summer (June, July, August; JJA) impacts, and blue lines represent winter (December, January, February; DJF) impacts. The shaded areas are the mean ± one standard deviation. Panels a, b, c, d were created in the R environment for statistical computing and graphics ( https://www.r-project.org/)
